name: suspensive
content:
suspensive adjective
(IN LAW)
Add to word list
Add to word list
having the power to suspend something (= stop it from happening or being active, either temporarily or permanently): suspensive condition The conclusion of the contract is subject to the suspensive condition of the candidate's success in passing the examination.suspensive effect His appeal has a suspensive effect only if it was lodged immediately after the announcement of the decision. A suspensive appeal has the effect of suspending the judge's decision. Related words
suspend
More examplesFewer examplesThe supreme magistrate was armed with a suspensive power, which allowed him to stop the population's movements whenever it suited him.
